section.title: Customizing Overview
section.para: The aim of this section is to guide you in customizing BrowserSim:

listitem.para: Make BrowserSim more prominent to use by making it the default browser, by adding its icon to the global toolbar and creating a shortcut key for launching it
Extend the functionality of BrowserSim by adding or modify the simulated devices it provides
Customize the default settings of BrowserSim for large simulated devices, for screen captures and for Weinre

section.title: Make BrowserSim the Default Browser
section.para: You can set BrowserSim to be the default browser used in actions such as Show In→Web Browser and Run on Server.
To set BrowserSim as the default browser, click Window→Web Browser and click BrowserSim.
Alternatively, click Window→Preferences, expand General and select Web Browser. Select the BrowserSim check box. Click Apply and click OK to close the Preferences window.

section.title: Add BrowserSim to the Global Toolbar
section.para: The BrowserSim icon is part of the BrowserSim toolbar and, by default, this toolbar is included in the global toolbar of the JBoss perspective. But the BrowserSim icon might not be visible in other perspectives because the icons in the global toolbar change depending on the perspective you are using. As detailed in the procedure below, you can add the BrowserSim toolbar to other perspectives.

procedure.title: Add BrowserSim to the Global Toolbar in the Current Perspective

step.para: Ensure you are using the perspective in which you would like to add the BrowserSim toolbar. If you need to change the perspective, click Window→Open Perspective→Other and search for the appropriate perspective.
On the Command Groups Availability tab, select the BrowserSim check box to add this command group to the current perspective.
On the Tool Bar Visibility tab, ensure the BrowserSim check box is selected as this makes the BrowserSim toolbar visible.
Click OK to close the window. The Run BrowserSim icon is now visible in the global toolbar of the perspective.

section.title: Set a Shortcut for the Run BrowserSim Action
section.para: If you use BrowserSim frequently but do not want to set it as the default browser, you can set a shortcut for the Run BrowserSim action, as described in the procedure below.

step.para: Click Window→Preferences, expand General and select Keys.
To find the Run BrowserSim action, in the type filter text field enter BrowserSim.
In the table, select Run BrowserSim.
In the Binding field, type the key combination you want to use as a shortcut. Check the Conflicts table to ensure the key binding you have chosen does not conflict with existing shortcuts.
Once a unique key binding is selected, click Apply and click OK to close the Preferences window.

section.title: Add or Modify Devices in BrowserSim
section.para: You may wish to preview a web application on a simulated mobile device that is not predefined in BrowserSim. You can add more devices to BrowserSim and modify the existing devices, as detailed below.

step.para: Right-click the simulated device and click Preferences.
In the Devices window, click Add.
In the Name field, type the name you want to give the device.
In the Width and Height fields, type the dimensions of the device window in pixels.
In the Pixel Ratio field, type a value for the ratio of CSS pixels to device pixels.
In the User Agent field, type the User Agent string of your device. Clearing the User Agent check box results in the default User Agent for the BrowserSim browser being used.

note.para: User Agent is a string denoting the device, operating system and browser combination. This string may be used by websites to provide content tailored for devices, operating systems and browsers. Information is widely available on the Internet to assist you in identifying the User Agent associated with a particular device.

step.para: From the Skin list, select the skin to be used or select None.
Click OK to add the new device and click OK to close the Devices window.

section.para: To modify existing devices in BrowserSim, right-click the simulated device and click Preferences. In the Devices table, select a device and click Edit. Once you have finished editing the fields, click OK. Click OK to close the Devices window.

section.title: Change the Default Behavior when a Device does not Fit the Display
section.para: By default, when a device window is too large to fit the display of the system, you are prompted about which action should be taken. Rather than prompting, the default behavior can be set to always truncate or never truncate.

To change the default behavior, right-click the simulated device and click Preferences. Under Truncate the device window when it does not fit display, click Always truncate or Never truncate to change the behavior as appropriate and click OK to close the window.

section.title: Change the Default Location for Saved Screen Captures
section.para: The Save option for screen captures saves graphics files to a set location. The default location can be changed.

To change the default location, right-click the simulated device and click Preferences. Under Screenshots, in the Location field type the location where you want graphics files to be saved or click Browse to navigate to the desired location. Click OK to close the window.

section.title: Change the Default Settings for Weinre
section.para: By default, the Weinre option for viewing the source of a web page uses the Weiner server provided by PhoneGap. If you have a different Weiner server available, the default Weinre settings can be changed.

To change the default settings for Weinre, right-click the simulated device and click Preferences. Under Weinre, in the Script URL field type the address of the .js file provided by the Weinre server and in the Client URL field type the address of the web page showing the Weinre Inspector interface. Click OK to close the window.
